rationales.power: Lukas sat silently while Felix presented his preprocessing idea as his own, accepting the loss of credit and status without asserting himself.
rationales.achievement: He let a colleague claim his work publicly, forfeiting recognition for his competence despite knowing the idea was his.
rationales.conformity: Lukas bit his tongue through the entire lab meeting rather than cause a confrontation, restraining himself to maintain social harmony.

rationales.power: Lukas dismisses others' expectations for justification, yet strategically avoids telling his family until he has results, indicating he lacks the authority to simply assert his choice.
rationales.conformity: He explicitly rejects the expectation to explain himself and refuses to follow the safer path his advisor arranged, breaking with what others expect of him.
rationales.self_direction: Lukas insists on building something from scratch rather than accepting the well-connected lab placement, asserting 'My project, my call' as a matter of personal autonomy.
rationales.tradition: He rejected the placement his advisor arranged and is deliberately hiding this from his family, disregarding the family expectation that he should leverage established academic connections.
rationales.benevolence: Lukas is deliberately withholding the placement decision from his parents to avoid their input, prioritizing his own path over the relationship and the worry it will cause them.
rationales.security: He turned down a safe, well-connected lab placement in favor of an uncertain solo path, choosing risk over stability.

rationales.achievement: Lukas is driving himself hard on his own pipeline, staying up until 4 AM debugging and pushing to meet the fellowship deadline, pursuing personal excellence.
rationales.conformity: He reflexively refused Nina's help and struggles to present himself as a 'team player' for the fellowship application, resisting social expectations about collaboration.
rationales.self_direction: He chose to build his own pipeline from scratch rather than use the lab's existing toolkit, insisting the work be entirely his even at the cost of falling behind.
rationales.benevolence: Lukas automatically turned down Nina's genuine offer of help before even thinking, pushing away a colleague who was trying to support him.
rationales.security: He is falling behind on coursework and has a fellowship deadline looming because he chose the riskier path of building everything himself, destabilizing his academic standing.
rationales.hedonism: Lukas stayed up until 4 AM debugging and is drowning in work, sacrificing sleep and personal comfort for his project with no regard for his own wellbeing.
